release.action: Complete removal of uploads to SourceForge
Upgrade to DirContextSource 2.1
Upgrade to Tomcat 8.5.12
Introduce GSSRealm interface for third-party implementations
ActiveDirectoryPrincipal now implements TomcatPrincipal
Add proper warning if referrals are expected to handle, but Oracle JDNI provider not able to do so
Renamed attribute resourceName to dirContextSourceName in ActiveDirectoryRealm
Remove code portions already implemented in Tomcat 8.5
Attribute storeDelegatedCredential has been moved to GSSAuthenticatorBase
Remove custom classes already present in Tomcat 8.5
Full code update to Tomcat 8.5
A CombinedActiveDirectoryRealm which iterates over multiple ActiveDirectoryRealms
Don't return principal with NULL_SID if not found in Active Directory
Have ActiveDirectoryPrincipal expose roles as SID strings via #getRoles()
Upgrade to DirContextSource 1.3
Don't log that referral throw is not handled
Make #getRelativeName() comparison case-insensitive as per RFC 2253
Avoid number overflows while parsing a SID from bytes
ActiveDirectoryRealm will properly inform about referral handling and log when not possible/failed
Return anonymous principal (ANONYMOUS_SID) if GSS context is anonymous
Realms return now principals with NULL_SID if not found instead of null because users are fully authenticated anyway
Add equals and hashCode to Sid
User search in ActiveDirectoryRealm will ignore users which are disabled
Change in signatures of GSSRealmBase
Authenticator and realm prefix 'GssAware' has been shortened to 'GSS' only
Authenticators do not analyze X-Requested-With header anymore
NTLM type 1 message is properly detected now
Authenticators will fail with Internal Server Error if security context requires continuation
Property strippableRoleNamePrefixes on realms has been removed
HTTP connections aren't closed on successful authentiction anymore
Improved logging messages
Improved overall documentation
Created VisualBasic scripts to mimic the UsernameSearchMapper implementations
Added an immutable SID (security identifier) implementation
Make roles by default stored as SID strings derived from objectSid and sIDHistory
Retrieve security-enabled roles only
Search in Active Directory for user and machine accounts only
ActiveDirectoryPrincipal does not contain the mech OID and DN anymore
ActiveDirectoryRealm queries role mappings from Context
Retrieve additional attributes from AD and store in the ActiveDirectoryPrincipal
Added documentation for Spring Security
